<strong style="display: block;">Which of the following best describes the weak form of the Efficient Market Hypothesis (EMH)?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q11" value="B"> B. Prices incorporate all historical price and volume data</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q11" value="C"> C. Prices incorporate only insider information</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q11" value="D"> D. Prices never follow a random walk</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q11" value="E"> E. Prices always reflect investors’ emotions</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module5_mcq_q11" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: B. Weak-form efficiency means past prices and volumes are already reflected in current prices, leaving no predictable patterns.
